channel.title: Laptop Setup
channel.description: Ok guys, I'm getting a Acer laptop with Vista and I wanted to know how to link it too my router ahead of time so I'm prepared Christmas day. Anyone know how to put it on my Desktop computer router?

item.title: Laptop Setup
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Life Java Is My Life™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Life wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:4, topic:250091”][quote author=Java Is My Life link=topic=329732.msg2577310#msg2577310 date=1229036721]
I don’t mean I want to link it atm I just want some instructions to do it so when I get it I don’t have too wait long.
[/quote]
Does the laptop you are getting have a wireless network card?

If it comes with vista, it will probably come with software that makes connecting to a router simple. In fact I guess vista must have its own software for connecting to your router…

Just look on the task bar and usually there is a wireless icon which you can right click and select something like “Find wireless networks”. Then just connect to your network… simple… nothing else needed.[/quote]

Yea true true. If XP has the connection on the task bar Vista definitley will.
Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Setup
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Java Is My Life™:

I don’t mean I want to link it atm I just want some instructions to do it so when I get it I don’t have too wait long.

Does the laptop you are getting have a wireless network card?

If it comes with vista, it will probably come with software that makes connecting to a router simple. In fact I guess vista must have its own software for connecting to your router…

Just look on the task bar and usually there is a wireless icon which you can right click and select something like “Find wireless networks”. Then just connect to your network… simple… nothing else needed.

Umm. You can’t. You have to wait to you get the computer to be able to network it.
